meanings.definition: To make a gesture with the hand, head, or other body part to encourage someone to come nearer or follow.
meanings.sent1: She becked her friend to join her at the park.
meanings.sent2: The coach was becking the players to gather around for a team meeting.
meanings.sent3: The magician becked the audience member on stage for a magic trick.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse becked ships safely to shore in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher becked the students to the front of the class for a group activity.

meanings.definition: The act of beckoning or signaling someone to come closer.
meanings.sent1: His becking was so inviting that everyone felt welcomed.
meanings.sent2: The child's becking brought a smile to the stranger's face.
meanings.sent3: The cat's becking for treats was met with a playful response.
meanings.sent4: The becking of the birds in the morning signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The queen's becking was a command that no one dared to ignore.
